newsitem.title: CHINA: Construction of Three Gorges airport finished.
newsitem.headline: Construction of Three Gorges airport finished.

text.p: China has completed construction of an airport near the huge Three Gorges dam project on the Yangtze river, the Xinhua Daily Telegraph said on Monday.
The airport is located in the Xiaoting district of Yichang city in the central province of Hubei, about 55 km (34 miles) from the Three Gorges project, the newspaper said.
With a 2,600-metre (8,530-ft) runway, the airport can accommodate Boeing 767s and handle 1.4 million passengers a year, it said.
The airport would soon open air routes linking Yichang with Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Wuhan and Chongqing, the newspaper said. It gave no further details.
In a related development, the Xiling Yangtze river bridge opened to traffic last Friday, the Xinhua news agency said. Construction took five years.
On Sunday, China announced plans to issue one billion yuan ($120 million) worth of three- and five-year bonds in November to help finance construction of the Three Gorges project.
Details of the planned bond issue were not given.
The $30 billion project is scheduled to dam the Yangtze river by the end of next year. Three Gorges -- the world's biggest water control project -- is scheduled to be completed in 2009.

The project will create a huge reservoir and is expected to reduce flooding along the 6,000-km (3,500-mile) Yangtze, China's longest river, and to provide an additional 85 million megawatt hours of electricity per year.
